						<p>The search for a Virginia man who authorities said fired shots at a woman while driving has a connection to Henderson.</p>
						
							
							
							
						
					
						<p>Virginia State Police are looking for Charles Stokes, who they said shot a woman while she was inside a car in Lunenburg County, Virginia, on Sunday afternoon. </p>
						
							
								
							
							
							
						
					
						<p>Police said Stokes fired into the vehicle as part of a domestic incident before driving away. The woman was taken to the hospital. Stokes, 44, works with the police force in Kenbridge, a town in Lunenburg County.</p>
						
							
							
							
						
					
						<p>The car Stokes was driving, a black Toyota Camry, was recovered later on Sunday at Brocklyn Hauling in Henderson.  Another vehicle, a 2007 silver Honda Civic with Virginia plates TGL 9143, was also reported stolen from the same location.  Stokes is believed to now be driving the Honda Civic.</p>
						
							
							
							
						
					
						<p>There are two felony warrants for aggravated malicious wounding and use of a firearm in the commission of a felony against Stokes, who should be considered armed and dangerous.</p>
						
							
							
							
						
					
						<p>Stokes was off duty at the time of the shooting. A Brocklyn Hauling employee did not offer a comment about the matter when asked by WRAL.</p>
						
							
							
							
						
					
						<p>There was no information provided by police about the injured woman's condition.</p>
